summary: An ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 7272 entitled: "An ordinance relating to and providing for the improvement of Battery Street, in the City of Seattle, from 6th Avenue to Denny Way, by grading, curbing and parking the same, according to the following plan; roadway to be 32 feet wide on both sides thereof; and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of 'Payment by Bonds' as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
